conversation.content:
[shaky voice] I checked the lines. I—I swear to God I checked them. [pause] Tommy was right there, he was... oh Jesus, he was just reaching for the—and then the whole thing just lit up. [very quietly] The safety ground wasn't... it wasn't connected right. How did I not see that? [gasp softly] His face, the way he just... frozen, couldn't even scream. 

[anxious] They're saying he might be okay but I saw it, you know? I saw the arc hit him. Twenty-three thousand volts. [stuttering] We-we've done this a hundred times, same routine, same checks. [bitter] "Always test twice," that's what they drill into you, right? And I did, I mean... I thought I did. 

[crying while speaking] His kids were just talking about their soccer game this morning. [pause] I was supposed to watch his back up there. That's the whole point of having a partner—we look out for each other. [very quietly] But I was rushing because, um... because dispatch was breathing down our necks about the outage. 

[shaky voice] They keep asking me what happened and I just—I don't even know what to tell them. The protocols failed? I failed? [trailing off] Tommy trusted me and now he's...

[whispering] God, what if he doesn't make it?

subject: Your telephone lineman safety protocols just failed and your partner got electrocuted on your watch
